title: Module 2: CURSOR_RULES - Defining Your Tech Stack

questions.question: CURSOR_RULES.md should be placed:
questions.explanation: CURSOR_RULES.md should be placed in the project root directory so Cursor AI can find and use it.

questions.question: The main purpose of CURSOR_RULES is to:
questions.explanation: CURSOR_RULES.md guides AI code generation by defining technology choices, code style, and project structure.

questions.question: When choosing a frontend framework, you should:
questions.explanation: Choose frameworks based on your project's specific needs, not just popularity or trends.

questions.question: For a simple static site, you should:
questions.explanation: For simple static sites, consider vanilla JavaScript to avoid unnecessary framework overhead.

questions.question: CURSOR_RULES should be:
questions.explanation: CURSOR_RULES should be specific and detailed to ensure AI generates code that matches your preferences.

questions.question: State management should be chosen based on:
questions.explanation: Choose state management based on your project's complexity needs, not just popularity.

questions.question: List three sections that should be in every CURSOR_RULES.md file.
questions.sampleAnswer: Essential sections include: Languages to use, Frontend framework preference, Styling approach, State management plan, Backend or data layer, Testing expectations, Security guidelines, Performance considerations, File organization conventions, Commit conventions.

questions.question: Why is it important to include examples in CURSOR_RULES?
questions.sampleAnswer: Examples help AI understand exactly what you want. They provide concrete patterns and clarify abstract concepts, leading to more accurate code generation.

questions.question: When should you update your CURSOR_RULES.md file?
questions.sampleAnswer: Update CURSOR_RULES when: adding new technologies, changing project requirements, learning better patterns, team preferences change, or when you need to refine your development approach.

questions.question: Explain the difference between choosing Tailwind CSS vs. CSS Modules for styling.
questions.sampleAnswer: Tailwind CSS is utility-first, speeds up development with pre-built classes, but can make HTML verbose. CSS Modules provide component-scoped styles, better for maintainability, but require more setup. Choose based on team preference and project needs.
